Package com.jimmyselectronics

Class AbstractDevice<T extends AbstractDeviceListener>

java.lang.Object
com.jimmyselectronics.AbstractDevice<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of listeners used for this device. For a device whose class is X, its corresponding listener interface would typically be XListener.
Direct Known Subclasses:
BarcodeScanner, CardReader, ElectronicScale, Key, Keyboard, ReceiptPrinterND, ReusableBagDispenser, TouchScreen
public abstract class AbstractDevice<T extends AbstractDeviceListener> extends Object
The abstract base class for all devices from Jimmy's Electronics.

This class utilizes the Observer design pattern. Subclasses inherit the register method, but each must define its own specialized notifyXXX methods according to the details of the event notification protocol (over and above enable/disable/turnOn/turnOff) in place.

Each device will normally be coupled to an appropriate listener interface, which extends AbstractDeviceListener; the type parameter T represents this listener. The associated, specialized subinterface must be designed in connection with the device class itself for the sake of a unified event notification protocol.

Any individual device can be disabled, which means it will not permit use of its state-changing methods. All such methods will declare to throw DisabledException.

Author:
Jimmy's Electronics LLP

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractDevice

      public AbstractDevice()

  • Method Details

    • isPluggedIn

      public boolean isPluggedIn()
      Checks whether this device is plugged-in.
      Returns:
      true if this device is plugged-in; otherwise, false.

    • isPoweredUp

      public boolean isPoweredUp()
      Checks whether this device is turned on and powered up.
      Returns:
      true if the device is plugged in, turned on, and receiving power; otherwise, false.

    • plugIn

      public void plugIn()
      Connects this device to the electrical power grid, leaving the power turned off. If the device is already plugged in or if its power is already turned on, this method does nothing.

    • unplug

      public void unplug()
      Disconnects this device from the electrical power grid. If the device is already disconnected, this method does nothing.

    • turnOn

      public void turnOn()
      Attempts to turn on the power to this device. If the device is already turned on or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing.

    • turnOff

      public void turnOff()
      Attempts to turn off the power to this device. If the device is already turned off or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing.

    • listeners

      public List<T> listeners()
      Obtains the registered listeners on this device. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of the listeners registered on this device.

    • deregister

      public boolean deregister(T listener)
      Locates the indicated listener and removes it such that it will no longer be informed of events from this device. If the listener is not currently registered with this device, calls to this method will return false, but otherwise have no effect. Does not require power.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the listener was found and removed, false otherwise.

    • deregisterAll

      public void deregisterAll()
      All listeners registered with this device are removed. If there are none, calls to this method have no effect.

    • register

      public final void register(T listener)
      Registers the indicated listener to receive event notifications from this device. Does not require power.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to be added.
      Throws:
      NullPointerSimulationException - If the argument is null.

    • disable

      public void disable()
      Disables this device from receiving input and producing output. Announces "disabled" event. Requires power.

    • enable

      public void enable()
      Enables this device for receiving input and producing output. Announces "enabled" event. Requires power.

    • isDisabled

      public final boolean isDisabled()
      Returns whether this device is currently disabled from receiving input and producing output. Requires power.
      Returns:
      true if the device is disabled; false if the device is enabled.
